verses.text: \w Observe|strong="H8104"\w* \w the|strong="H3588"\w* \w month|strong="H2320"\w* \w of|strong="H3068"\w* Abib \f + \fr 16:1 \ft Abib was the first month of the ancient Hebrew lunar calendar, usually occurring within the months of March and April; twice in this verse.\f* \w and|strong="H3068"\w* \w celebrate|strong="H6213"\w* \w the|strong="H3588"\w* \w Passover|strong="H6453"\w* \w to|strong="H3318"\w* \w the|strong="H3588"\w* \w LORD|strong="H3068"\w* \w your|strong="H3068"\w* \w God|strong="H3068"\w*, \w because|strong="H3588"\w* \w in|strong="H3068"\w* \w the|strong="H3588"\w* \w month|strong="H2320"\w* \w of|strong="H3068"\w* Abib \w the|strong="H3588"\w* \w LORD|strong="H3068"\w* \w your|strong="H3068"\w* \w God|strong="H3068"\w* \w brought|strong="H3318"\w* \w you|strong="H3588"\w* \w out|strong="H3318"\w* \w of|strong="H3068"\w* \w Egypt|strong="H4714"\w* \w by|strong="H3068"\w* \w night|strong="H3915"\w*.

\w Three|strong="H7969"\w* \w times|strong="H6471"\w* \w a|strong="H3068"\w* \w year|strong="H8141"\w* \w all|strong="H3605"\w* \w your|strong="H3068"\w* \w men|strong="H3605"\w* \w are|strong="H3068"\w* \w to|strong="H3068"\w* \w appear|strong="H7200"\w* \w before|strong="H6440"\w* \w the|strong="H3605"\w* \w LORD|strong="H3068"\w* \w your|strong="H3068"\w* \w God|strong="H3068"\w* \w in|strong="H8141"\w* \w the|strong="H3605"\w* \w place|strong="H4725"\w* \w He|strong="H3068"\w* \w will|strong="H3068"\w* choose: \w at|strong="H3068"\w* \w the|strong="H3605"\w* \w Feast|strong="H2282"\w* \w of|strong="H3068"\w* \w Unleavened|strong="H4682"\w* \w Bread|strong="H4682"\w*,\f + \fr 16:16 \ft That is, the seven-day period after the Passover during which no leaven may be eaten; see Exodus 12:14–20.\f* \w the|strong="H3605"\w* \w Feast|strong="H2282"\w* \w of|strong="H3068"\w* \w Weeks|strong="H7620"\w*,\f + \fr 16:16 \ft That is, Shavuot, the late spring feast of pilgrimage to Jerusalem; it is also known as the Feast of Harvest (see Exodus 23:16) or the Feast of Pentecost (see Acts 2:1).\f* \w and|strong="H3068"\w* \w the|strong="H3605"\w* \w Feast|strong="H2282"\w* \w of|strong="H3068"\w* \w Tabernacles|strong="H5521"\w*.\f + \fr 16:16 \ft That is, Sukkot, the autumn feast of pilgrimage to Jerusalem; also translated as the Feast of Booths or the Feast of Shelters and originally called the Feast of Ingathering (see Exodus 23:16 and Exodus 34:22).\f* \w No|strong="H3808"\w* \w one|strong="H3605"\w* \w should|strong="H3068"\w* \w appear|strong="H7200"\w* \w before|strong="H6440"\w* \w the|strong="H3605"\w* \w LORD|strong="H3068"\w* \w empty-handed|strong="H7387"\w*.

Everyone must appear \w with|strong="H3068"\w* \w a|strong="H3068"\w* \w gift|strong="H4979"\w* \w as|strong="H3068"\w* \w he|strong="H3068"\w* \w is|strong="H3068"\w* \w able|strong="H3027"\w*, \w according|strong="H3027"\w* \w to|strong="H3068"\w* \w the|strong="H5414"\w* \w blessing|strong="H1293"\w* \w the|strong="H5414"\w* \w LORD|strong="H3068"\w* \w your|strong="H3068"\w* \w God|strong="H3068"\w* \w has|strong="H3068"\w* \w given|strong="H5414"\w* \w you|strong="H5414"\w*.
